body:
Comment 9: 
did gdb report new threads being created just before the crash?

Yes.  For variables that live entirely in registers, the stack entries
are trimmed from the code and the linker doesn't generate debug info
for them.  This is a separate issue, marked 'later', and will require
to generate some dwarf in the compiler, instead of in the linker as
happens now.  You can disable optimisation on the compiler with the -N
flag while debugging, as a workaround.
